website_summaries.verdict: Despite some concerns, this small appliance is worth considering if you like the idea of stuffing your chaffles with bacon, fruit, and other fillings.
pros: Turns waffles into a bowl-shape that's perfect for filling them with other ingredients
Nonstick surface is easy to clean
Makes two "deep dish" or stuffed chaffles at a time
cons: Doesn't cook as fast as some other models we considered, and doesn't always produce even results

customer_reviews.title: Nice, heavy duty item.
customer_reviews.text: Love that the entire shell of this bowl maker is metal - great quality. I use it to make chaffle bowls to fill with chicken salad (pictured), taco meat w/trimmings, and keto-low carb sloppy joes. Mix 1 egg, 1/2 cup of shredded cheese (I prefer swiss), 1 tsp coconut flour, and spices (onion, garlic powder this time, everything but the bagel seasoning usually) - put half of the mixture in each bowl after you've coated it with butter or high temp oil like coconut oil, and go! They were wonderful, just fold as you eat in a pita-like way. Great item, love it!
customer_reviews.author: C.P.

customer_reviews.title: Neat treat.
customer_reviews.text: The waffle cups are just the right size for fruit and nuts. Almost anything. We're looking forward to trying some cornbread waffles with chili!
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Fun, easy & delicious meal
customer_reviews.text: We just used it for the 1st time. Did exactly as directions said but used a store waffle mix. Used a bit less than 1/2 cup & cooked for 4 minutes-turned out perfect! They were crispy on the outside & soft in middle. We filled them with raspberries, blueberries & strawberries-topped with whipped topping. They were wonderful & so easy. I wiped the cups with a paper towel with vegetable oil before each set of waffles-no sticking. Just wiped off with damp cloth when finished. I am looking forward to doing corn muffin mix bowls with chile & hash brown bowls with eggs. Really fun & easy & so good!
